  • Field Details

    • forgot_button

      public javafx.scene.control.Button forgot_button
      Contains all the fields, labels, and variables needed to log in. All the labels are buttons are needed so they can be translated into French. Locale and language is based off of the system's locale. The default language is set to English, since all the FXML files are made with English names, later to be translated to French when needed.

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage) throws Exception
      Starts off the program by loading the first screen, login_screen.
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:

      Throws:
      Exception - exception thrown in event of error.

    • forgotClick

      public void forgotClick()
      Simple forgot-password button. Simply tells user to contact their administrator for support. Can later be implemented with a real find-password function.

    • exitClick

      public void exitClick()
      Quits the program. Prompts user with a YES-NO choice. If YES, closes the DB connection and then exits.

    • loginCheck

      public static boolean loginCheck(String username, String password) throws SQLException
      Parameters:
      username - Takes in a username from the username field (implemented more in loginClick().
      password - Takes in a password from the password field (implemented more in loginClick().
      Returns:
      Returns true if there is a result in the ResultSet, indicating there is a match on username and password.
      Throws:
      SQLException - throws an SQL exception if met.

    • getUsername

      public static String getUsername()
      Used as part of getting the user for created-by details and users as part of appointments.
      Returns:
      returns the variable loggedUser.

    • setUserName

      public void setUserName(String userName)
      Used to set the username on successful login, so the right user can be accessed by getUsername().
      Parameters:
      userName - takes in a successful login username and assigns to the class variable loggedUser.

    • unsetUsername

      public static void unsetUsername()
      Sets loggedUser to null when we use the LOGOUT function in the Home, Customer, and Appointment screens.

    • setAppointmentIdMessage

      public void setAppointmentIdMessage(int appointmentID)
      Setters and Getters for the message on login, checking if there is an appointment within 15min of login.
      Parameters:
      appointmentID - gets an ID to set the class variable to.

      public int getAppointmentIdMessage()

    • getAppointmentUserTime

      public String getAppointmentUserTime()

    • isEnglish

      public static boolean isEnglish()
      Returns the boolean languageIsEnglish. That boolean variable value may be changed in setStuff().

    • loginClick

      public void loginClick()
      Performs the checks for a login when the login button is clicked. Takes in the username field and password field and passes them to loginCheck to look for a match. On successful match, creates a text file login_activity.txt if it doesn't exist. Writes the current UTC times, username, and whether it was a successful or failed login to the text file. On success, runs checkAppointmentsSoon, to see if an appointment exists within 15min of login. On failure, shows a message saying the username or password is incorrect and wrties the result to the text file.

    • setStuff

      public void setStuff()
      These could be in the initialize function, but I've separated them this time. When the program loads, check the locale and get the Display Language.\ Sets the languageIsEnglish boolean according to the result of a check on the display language equaling "English".

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      Executes setStuff when the login screen is loaded.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Starts the program by connecting to the DB. Launches the window, which loads login_screen. Closes the connection when the program is exited via X button on the window.
